diff_hunk:
@@ -54,6 +54,13 @@ def __init__(self, module, device_ids=None, output_device=None, dim=0):
 
         if device_ids is None:
             device_ids = list(range(torch.cuda.device_count()))
+
+        devices_memory = [torch.cuda.max_memory_allocated(i) for i in device_ids]
+        if max(devices_memory) / min(devices_memory) >= 3.0:
body_html:
awesome, thanks!

@apaszke suggested in #5386 that we expose the whole struct. Since we'd have all info, should we also check the number of cuda cores? The GT710 has 192 cores, while the TITAN X has 3584 (almost 20x).

Maybe I should open an issue if we want to discuss further.
